title: Insane PING, well over 2500++ consistently
body:
Ever since last nights patch, I've played 3 games. Every single game my ping sits around 1800 ping once the game is about 1 minute in. It spikes up to well over 3000++ ping and holds for quite some time.

I played all day yesterday pre-patch with no problems. Never having this issue. I've done everything on my end including call my ISP and there are no issues. Something in the new patch is causing this.

Nothing lags at all until I GET INTO THE GAME. Then Ventrilo, League, Browsers everything spikes and eats shit and lags.

Riot you need to get on this, I've read a few other posts as well.

I turned off peer2peer sharing within League. Still lags. Tried on lolping.org says I should have about 115ping but in reality I always have aroun 40-60ping. Now after this patch again from 1800-3000+++

replies.body: I'm having the same issue since the last nights patch, my ping is normal until minions get to the middle of the lanes and that's where it all goes down hill. Ping never goes under like 200 but it goes all over the place up to 2k+. Anything else that I'm trying to run that requires internet such as a web browser lags too while playing the game. I have already made a post and the only response I got from the player support was to try troubleshooting my connection.
SAME. EXACT. PROBLEM. Only when minions get to lane I spike to 2000+ all game.

Literally exact same thing as you. Tried everything on my end. This is a riot end issue 100% not on my end. Literally started right after the patch considering I've been playing A LOT the last few weeks with no issues, and coincidently this starts after a patch..

Same exact problem here. Everything shows fine and when Im in game 2000+ ping all game ever since the patch yesterday. Literally couldn't do anything in my ranked game and lost a series for it. Please fix!

After updating my network logs here are the reports copy pasted

Your average ping was 1547 milliseconds.

The worst ping you experienced was 3604ms. This means you experienced high ping during this game, which is likely where you were seeing issues. See below for a few recommendations to help out with this.

Your average percentage of packet loss for this game was 11.17%.

Overall, this means you had a high amount of packets lost during the game. This can be caused by various network issues, so please see below for a few common steps that can help reduce packet loss.

Thanks for providing additional context from your network log. I double-checked and was unable to find any records of server issues from our side on the NA region. Did you already work through the steps within the [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) that the log reader would have suggested?

Yeah, I've done literally everything and called ISP and everything is find on there end.

This literally started right after the patch. It's not on my end I've tried everything. Zero lag in any other game, any voice communication, any internet use or browsing.

Start a game, about 1-2 minutes in once minions are fighting, ping sits around 1500 spiking to 3000 constantly for entire game. Unplayable.

Since those steps didn't produce any noticeable changes, we'll have to look at your network routing to our servers to determine where the issue is happening between your PC and our servers. I strongly recommend using a networking app called [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/) to run this. Simply boot up the application and plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field, then start the trace! After the trace has gone on for 5 minutes or longer, you can export the results *as text* and paste them in a reply to me.

If you encounter issues with these steps, let me know!
